info.title: Azure AD Identity and Access
info.description: A connector for Azure AD Identity and Access. This connector will contain multiple actions to manage Azure AD Identity and Access. An example of this is for instance inviting guest users. In the future, more actions will be added.

post.description: Create an invitation for an external user.

ccRecipients.title: CC Recipients
ccRecipients.description: Additional recipients the invitation message should be sent to. Currently only 1 additional recipient is supported.

emailAddress.description: The email address object (both display name and email address) of the person or entity.

address.title: Email
address.description: The email address of the person or entity.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the person or entity.

invitedUser.title: Invited User
invitedUser.description: The user created as part of the invitation creation.

id.title: ID
id.description: The id of the invited user.

invitedUserDisplayName.title: Invited User Display Name
invitedUserDisplayName.description: The display name of the user being invited.

invitedUserEmailAddress.title: Invited User Email Address
invitedUserEmailAddress.description: The email address of the user being invited.

invitedUserMessageInfo.description: Additional configuration for the message being sent to the invited user, including customizing message text, language and cc recipient list.

customizedMessageBody.title: Customized Message
customizedMessageBody.description: Customized message body you want to send if you don't want the default message.

messageLanguage.title: Message Language
messageLanguage.description: The language you want to send the default message in. If the customized message body is specified, this property is ignored, and the message is sent using the customized message body. The language format should be in ISO 639. The default is en-US.

invitedUserType.title: Invited User Type
invitedUserType.description: The user type of the user being invited. You can invite as Member if you are a company administrator.

inviteRedeemUrl.title: Invite Redeem URL
inviteRedeemUrl.description: The URL the user can use to redeem their invitation.

resetRedemption.title: Reset Redemption
resetRedemption.description: Reset the user's redemption status and reinvite a user while retaining their user identifier, group memberships, and app assignments. This property allows you to enable a user to sign-in using a different email address from the one in the previous invitation.

sendInvitationMessage.title: Send Invitation Message
sendInvitationMessage.description: Indicates whether an email should be sent to the user being invited.
